1.content:
(A young boy holds onto a bunch of balloons, floating upwards into the sky. He lets go and lands on the curve of the moon. He gets out a cane pole and casts. Suddenly, a UFO shows up and abducts the boy in a beam of light.)

Which character do you wish to start the story?
1.title: Which Character?

choices: A Lifeguard showed up- the Others are causing Too much Trouble.
General Monger showed up- he's got Big News
General Monger showed up- Out of Uniform
11.content:
Susan sighed in satisfaction as she lay on the smooth sand, enjoying the sun rays tanning her fifty foot long body. It had taken some wheeling and dealing, and a small photo-op with a few local politicians and businessmen, but she and her friends were finally relaxing on Coco Beach. Of course, to keep the locals, and the money-spending tourists, happy, she and her friends were about half a mile away from the normal place that most people went to, and hidden from view by some cliffs- or at least, most of them were- there was no way that Butterflysaurus could keep his 250 foot height away from view. Also, Link was busy chasing some co-eds, and making up for twenty thousand, plus fifty, years of lost time- well, trying to. B.O.B., well, he wasn't causing much trouble, except for thinking that other peoples thoughts were his own, and being a little too much of a hugger.

"I hope those two are staying out of trouble," she said, as she looked at her other friend, Dr. Cockroach. Of course, the half-man half-cockroach scientist was tinkering away with something, as usual. "What are you working on this time?"

"You remember that Gallaxhar was able to shrink you down to normal size right?"

"Yes, I remember that quite well," Susan said as she turned on her side, so that she could look at her friend more easily, and tan more evenly. "He extracted the quantonium that was within my body to do it. Only problem was that my hair didn't go back to brown, plus he used the quantonium to produce clones of himself to try and take over the world. Got the element, and my abilities, back when I let the orb fall on me after I destroyed the statue that was holding it."

"Well, as you know, General Monger had his men gather the wreckage, so that the scientists back at the Base can study it, and perhaps build defenses against other potential alien threats," Dr. Cockroach said with a grin. "The good General has allowed me to work with the scientists, though I do have to let them in on anything I find out."

"And, what have you found?"

"I found out how he managed to extract the quantonium, and I've managed to replicate the process."

"How'd you replicate the process? You haven't shrunk me yet."

"No, but I did use one of the hairs that get pulled out when you brush your hair," Dr. Cockroach said, as he pulled a foot long piece of hair from one of the pockets in his lab coat. Susan leaned closer to take a better look at it- it was brown, her original hair color- that hadn't happened when Gallaxhar had shrunk her. "There is no trace of quantonium at all."

"That's just incredible," Susan said with a smile. "Of course, you do realize that I'm alright with my size now."

"Yes, and that's why I'm making some modifications to Gallaxhar's process," Dr. Cockroach said. "Muhaha!"

"Doctor."

"Oh, yes, right. Still working on that," Dr. Cockroach chuckled slightly. "Like I said, I've made some modifications- instead of extracting the quantonium, this machine will instead concentrate it, so that you will be able to shrink yourself to normal-size, or even smaller, say the size of a fly, and so that you will be able to grow to the size of Butterflysaurus."

"Um, why would you do that?"

"Well, the extra size would make you stronger. The smaller size would help you with small places," Dr. Cockroach said with a smile. "After all, spending time with your parents would be more easier if you were more normal sized, like me, Link, and B.O.B.."

"Yeah, that it would be," Susan chuckled.

"Plus, it will help you to get a new boyfriend more easily."

Susan blushed- her size had indeed put off plenty of men, though the military detail that had been with her on the few times she had had a date had done a number to a few as well, as had the sight of her friends.

"Well, I guess that would be a help there to," she said. "I mean, it's true that there are indeed those who are into big women, even those interested in giant-sized women, like macrophilias, but when they see the real thing, they tend to want to leave, and be with someone more their size."

"Also, a young woman such as yourself has certain needs and wants," the Doctor chuckled.

"Meaning?"

"Well, um, sometimes you long for a certain type of intimacy, but you're afraid of hurting someone due to your size, and I don't mean just giving someone a hug and a kiss."

"Oh, yeah, there is that," Susan said with a slight chuckle. "Been a while since I've done that, at least a few weeks before I was turned into a giantess. It was fun when me and Derick did it- though he always made sure that we both used protection. He didn't want someone to get wind of some scandal involving him- though we were engaged at the time."

"Well, if you ever feel the need, there is someone who'd be more than able to assist you with that issue."

"Are you talking about Link? He has been hitting on me more often lately, though he's been doing that with most of the other women at the base under the age of thirty."

"No, not Link, though if you wanted him I'm sure he'd be more more than willing, and able, to help you out with that. Actually, I was referring to someone else." The half-cockroach half-man then turned back to his machine, and started tinkering with it again.

"Wait, you mean, you're interested in me in that way?"

"Who else," Dr. Cockroach chuckled. "B.O.B.'s got the mind of a child, and it's not like there's any other humanoid male monsters at the base besides me and Link- and while Link sees you as a good friend, he doesn't know if it could be possible that way between you and him."

"You do know that you are old enough to be my grandfather, and then some, right?"

"It's true that I'm almost eighty years old- however, thanks to my cockroach DNA, I have the body of a thirty year old man, and I'll be honest, it does have certain urges, beyond the need to eat garbage," Dr. Cockroach turned to face Susan again. "Besides, as I've said before, and as you know for yourself, from when we first met, you can't crush a Cockroach."

"I'll have to think about that," Susan said. She then kissed one of her fingers and touched the Doctor's lips with it. "Thanks for the offer though."

"You're welcome," the Doctor said, turning back to his tinkering, trying to hide his shuffling feet by moving around the device. It wasn't a kiss, he thought. But, considering her size, it will do for now. He then licked his lips, as if he was busy thinking about something. Her saliva has an interesting taste- like a mixture of roses and slightly over-ripened apples, but even better than that.

"So, besides this shrinking device, are you working on anything else?" Susan asked.

"Well, I am working on one that can turn my body into that of a human, and allow me to change into this one if need be," the Doctor said. "It would make things more easier- I wouldn't get chased out of a place that was worried they'd be fined for health violations."

"I guess that would be good," Susan said as she laid down on her front. "Especially if you and I ever went out on a date."

The Doctor chuckled. "Very true."

Just then-
11.title: Susan Murphy/Ginormica

choices: Dared Dr. Cockroach to go get, and wear, a Speedo
said, "Well, best get back to having fun."
said, "Get the others- I've got Big News."
113.content:
"Good evening Ginormica," said a familiar voice. "Good evening to you to Dr. Cockroach."

"Good evening to you as well General," Susan said as she propped herself on her elbows, and turned her head. Much to her surprise, the ninety-year old, yet physically-fit, General was out of his usual army uniform, wearing instead a pair of speedos that said "US Army Issue." "Um, interesting outfit."

The General grinned, his chiseled chin just cutting the air as he talked. "The military's been going through a few fashion changes since I last swam in public- these things are bulletproof, tear-resistant, maintain the temperature of the area, and a few other details, some of which are so highly classified, I'd have to kill you if I told you."

"No offense sir, but there's no way you'd get me to wear those things," Dr. Cockroach said with a chuckle.

"Are you worried about what people might see if you wore something besides that lab coat Slim Jim?"

"No, but I don't think I'd be comfortable wearing one of those."

The General then-
113.title: General Monger showed up- Out of Uniform

1132.content:
"Well, best get back to having fun- we're having a barbecue," the General said. "Ginormica, I hope you like seafood."

"Oh I do," Susan said, as she stood up. "What's on the menu? Is is lobsters? I'm quite partial to those."

"No luck on the overgrown crayfish, but there is a 20-foot great white shark with your name on it," the General chuckled. "The thing was menacing some of the female surfers, so I decided to wrestle it- I would have won but Link swam in front of it- gave the poor thing a heart attack. Needless to say, that's the main course."

"Um, I'm not into shark meat much," Susan chuckled nervously.

"No problem- more for me and the others then," Monger laughed. "I'll have a chat with one of the fishing boats- yellowfin tuna school around here, and I know very well you don't mind eating tuna- I'll see that it's cooked several different ways."

The General then ran towards the water and dived in, swimming away.

"You know, it has been a while since I've had shark meat," Dr. Cockroach said. "One had died at a nearby sea life aquarium. Monger had his contacts buy the body for 'scientific testing', though it was really to be Link's meal- he was partial to that type of shark at the time. Problem was, when it had been delivered to the base, it had aged a bit. As a result, I got to eat it- it was interesting to say the least, lots of flavors, plus there was several different objects in its stomach, like this one leather boot- very tasty."

Susan chuckled. "How about you get to work on your machines."

Dr. Cockroach smiled.
1132.title: Invited to a Barbecue

11323.content:
A while later, Susan and Dr. Cockroach were at the barbecue. Just like the general had said, there was a twenty-foot long Great White shark being cooked over several fires. It had been cut up for easier management, and was being cooked in several ways. There was also plenty of tuna being cooked, also in a variety of ways. There was fish being grilled, fried, baked, stewed, poached, and more.

"The food looks quite lovely," Dr. Cockroach said as the two of them walked around. "And the shark looks exquisite- wouldn't be too surprised if Monger and Link posed with it before they had it cut up."

"I've seen the movie Jaws before, and a few of it's sequels," Susan said, shuddering as she looked at the shark's head, which the General and Link were standing by, and having their picture taken. "I couldn't go swimming for a few months, not even in the creek near my home."

"Well, I doubt you'd have much to worry from them anyways," Dr. Cockroach said. "They don't normally bother humans, and prefer seals and large fish, like tuna. Most attacks on humans are believed to be a result of mistaken identification."

"You've studied sharks?"

"Not much to do at the base beyond reading and watching movies," the doctor said. "I'd probably hold more than a few degrees in various fields of biology, robotics, and more, if I were to take tests for their equivalency."

"You've also tried to use what you know to escape," the general said, as he walked towards them.

"Oh please, don't mention it," the doctor chuckled. "I mean, it wasn't easy to get some of the needed items. Even then, it didn't work out the way I wanted it."

"What do you mean?" Susan asked.

"The doc accidentally gave B.O.B. the ability to read minds," Monger said, with a chuckle. "Certainly made that Tuesday interesting."

"Yes, but sadly, the isotope was dissolved by him," the doctor said with a nervous chuckle. "None of us got our freedom that day."

"But if you had been able to make it, you wouldn't have met me, and we wouldn't have saved the world," Susan said.

Dr. Cockroach smiled. "There is that."

"Is there something going on between the two of you?" Monger asked, looking at the pair.

"Well, I don't know," Dr. Cockroach said nervously.

"We're sort of starting to work on it," Susan blushed.

"Regulations frown upon certain types of relationships between fellow soldiers, especially sexual ones," Monger said. Then he chuckled. "But you're not soldiers, and that regulation wouldn't be for you anyways."

"What gave you the idea we were going to do something like that?"

Monger chuckled. "I'm ninety years old- I know plenty of things. Just be careful when you do it- I don't want to hire a gynecologist to help you out if something happens during the process."

"Um, thanks."

"Any time," the general said, as he walked over to a communications officer, who was beckoning him over.

"Well, let's get to having some fun," Dr. Cockroach said with a chuckle.
11323.title: Later, at the Barbecue

113232.content:
"Hey guys," Monger said, as he stepped away from his communication officer. "We've got some trouble to take care of."

"Where's the trouble?" Susan asked, as she and the others walked up to him.

"It's...."
113232.title: Trouble

1132321.content:
"The trouble's in your home town Ginormica," Monger said. "Your father's been trying to get a hold of you, and managed to get my number. Something is going on in the area."

"What sort of something?"
1132321.title: Modesto, California

11323211.content:
"It seems that there is some sort of creature wondering around the area," Monger said. "So far it hasn't caused any problems, but there is that worry."

"So, what are we going to do?" Link asked.

"Normal operating procedures are to gather information and then either destroy or capture the creature," Monger said. "However, given how well you took care of those vegetables, with minimal damage, I've decided that you guys, along with myself, will go and deal with the situation."

"Well what are we waiting for?"

"Let's go."
11323211.title: Some sort of creature

113232112.content:
A few hours later, Susan was walking along the streets of Modesto. She gave a sigh as she passed familiar homes, stores, and other buildings, places she once had been able to walk inside of, but not anymore.

"Don't worry so much," Dr. Cockroach said from her shoulder. "I promise you, you'll be walking inside of them again- I just need one more crucial item to make my machine fully work."

"Really?" Susan asked with a smile.

"Of course," Dr. Cockroach chuckled. "Of course, getting it might be a problem."

"Why? You have the resources of the entire military you can use."

"True, but the item needed is very rare, and hard to find- I only came across what I used in the test by pure accident."

"Is there any more left then?"

"Yes, but I wouldn't risk using it on anyone- not even B.O.B., and he's indestructible. The remaining sample is very degraded, and over a century old."

"Doctor, did you use what was in vial X-3247?" General Monger asked with a shout.

"Of course I did," Dr. Cockroach said, in a slightly louder voice than normal.

"Well that explains my case of 'Missing Inventory' from last week," the General said. "Don't you dare use what is in vial X-3246- my great-grandfather got that sample, and I'll kill you if you mess with it- got it?"

"Understood sir."
113232112.title: No Place Like Home

choices: Susan goes to visit her family.
1132321122.content:
"Hello Susan," shouted a familiar sounding voice.

Susan looked down, and saw a certain man carrying a microphone, with a cameraman behind him.

"Dude, this is a bad idea," said the cameraman, shaking his head.

"What are you up to, Derek?" Susan asked, as she knelt down.

"I still want that interview," Derek said with a chuckle. "But more importantly, I'm inviting you to my wedding this weekend."

"I feel sorry to whomever you proposed to," Dr. Cockroach said as he got off of Susan's shoulder.

"I agree," said Link walking up. "You dumped Susan all because she went through a huge growth spurt. I wonder what's going to happen when your intended gets gray hair, wrinkles, and saggy in the front, not to mention baggy in the back." He then looked at the General. "Or is that the other way around?"

"That's one of those things you don't talk about," said Monger, as he inspected his new Jeep. "You lose either way you say it."

"Like I have to worry about that," chuckled Derek. "I'm not marrying for looks." He pulled out a picture, and showed it to the group. The woman in it had a wonky nose, square glasses, green-yellow eyes, red hair, freckles, and pale skin.

"You're marrying an image of some ugly looking girl instead of me?" B.O.B. asked. "I mean, after all of our plans for the future?"

"B.O.B., you're in love with a green jello with fourteen chunks of pineapple inside of it," said Link.

"I forgot about that," said B.O.B.. "Um, would you mind helping me set up the wedding? I'll make you guys my Best Men, though Susan can be my Best Lady."

"We'll think about that," Dr. Cockroach said.

Susan looked closely at the picture. "Wait a minute- that's Molly Vinta, heir to the Vintage Winery fortune."

"Yep," Derek chuckled. "And half of it will be mine when her parents die- hopefully of natural causes of course. Five hundred million dollars has a nice ring to it- though one does have to account for future inflation, and further acquisitions. Probably be worth at least seven hundred fifty million in a few decades."

Dr. Cockroach scoffed. "Susan gets two billion per year to use for her needs."

"Two billion?" Susan asked. "How come I've never seen this money?"

"Because I've been managing it," said Monger. "How do you think I've manage to get you the food and clothing you need during your stay? It's not like we use Food Stamps."

"Don't worry," said Link. "We've been talking to him into seeing about getting us some Walking Around money to use when we're out in public."

"Hopefully that will come from the money they used to use to keep us locked up at the Base," said Dr. Cockroach.

"Yes, I've been working on that with the bean counters," said Monger. "They are worse at giving out money than the IRS- won't even think about giving any without thirty forms signed in triplicate on each of their respective desks, and another five hundred per person to finalize the details, and a bunch more to actually hand out the money."

"Like that matters," said Derek. "At least I don't need to worry about her destroying the church on our wedding day."

Susan groaned. No one would live that day down.
1132321122.title: Meeting Derek

choices: Susan and Dr. Cockroach are talking about their feelings.
11323211221.content:
"Come on guys," Susan said as she started walking. "Let's go to my parents' place. I don't like hearing Derick bring up the past."

"Derek, if you really love that Vinta girl, I suggest you treat her a whole lot better than you did Susan," Monger said as he turned his jeep back on.

"Like you really care about her," Derek said with a chuckle. "You had her locked up in some underground facility and experimented on her."

Monger grabbed a hold of Derek's collar and pulled him next to the jeep. "Listen to me you little pansy- Momma-wipes-my-nose Paste-eating trash-talking Good-for-nothing excuse for a weather reporter! I may have had her locked up, and held her largely against her will, but I never disrespected her, or any of the others in my charge. In many ways I put them first before my own self, even humoring them on occasion."

"You mean you're also a comedian?" B.O.B. asked.

"Yeah let's go with that," said Monger as he looked at the blob creature.

"In that case, I'd like it if you could tell jokes at mine and Miss Jello's wedding."

"We'll see about that, after we complete our objective."

"Thanks General," said B.O.B. as he began following the others. "You're the best friend a blue blob could have."

"He's not too bad once you actually get to know him," said Monger. "Same with Link and Dr. Cockroach." He then looked back at Derek. "As for Susan, if I hear anything bad about her said, written, or any other way of communication, I'll see that you get stationed at an Army outpost."

"A military assignment doesn't sound too bad," Derek chuckled. "Might even improve my ratings by being a Wartime correspondent."

"The only way you'd be one is if Russia decided to invade us through the Bering Strait," said Monger. "I'll have you stationed at the most remote outpost in Alaska I can find- might even place you someplace Top Secret, someplace where if you open your mouth, the janitor there would be under orders to give you one heck of a swirly in the toilet."

Derek gulped. "I understand."

"Good," Monger said as he let go. "I'll be watching you." He then took off.

Derek turned and looked at his cameraman, who had his camera pointed at him. "Get that thing out of my face, Pete," Derek said as he pushed the man to the side.

Pete smiled as he took out a disk- he'd captured the whole exchange. Now he had a way to get some much needed Vacation days.

***

A while later, Susan was finally at her parents' place.

"Susan!" Carl shouted as he and Wendy came running out the door towards her.

Susan smiled as she knelt down, and let her parents grab a hold of her thumbs.

"How's our little girl doing?" Wendy asked.

"I'm doing just fine," Susan said as she lowered her head by her parents.

"It's so good to see you," Carl said as he patted on of her cheeks and Wendy kissed the other.

"I've got your favorites cooked up," Wendy said. "I don't know if it will be enough for everyone, but I'm sure that a taste of my cooking will make things easier for you."

"Thanks mom."

Later...
11323211221.title: Susan goes to visit her family.

choices: The Pair are Interrupted- the monster's been spotted.
113232112211.content:
Susan and Dr. Cockroach were walking after supper, though Dr. Cockroach was riding on Susan's shoulder.

"It's a lovely evening," said Dr. Cockroach.

"It is," Susan said with a sigh.

"Is something wrong?" Dr. Cockroach asked.

"We've been friends for over six months, but I don't even know your real name," Susan said.

Dr. Cockroach smiled. "I was born Andrew Delmar."

Susan smiled. "That's a good name."

"Yeah, but I like the one I use now," said Doctor Cockroach. "Of course, circumstances might persuade me to take back up my old one."

"Such as?"

"If you and me got married."

"What are you saying Doctor?"

Dr. Cockroach got out a small cardboard box, and opened it. Inside was a diamond ring. "Found this when I was going through a garbage can on the beach. I think it's Fate's way of saying we're meant to be together."

"Are you asking me to marry you?"

Dr. Cockroach nodded.

"In that case, you'd better ask me."

Dr. Cockroach stood up, and got on bent knee. "Susan Murphy; All I have to myself is my name and whatever garbage I find interesting enough to use in my projects, along with this ring. However, I ask for your hand in marriage, and I promise to love you, and only you, though if we have children, that love will be shared with them equally. It's what I can offer you, but that's more than some get when they get married."

Susan smiled. "Andrew Delmar; I accept your hand in marriage- providing that you ask my mother and father, and get their blessing to do so. Also, I'd like it if you'd use your real name at our wedding. I'd be proud to be called Susan Delmar." She then turned her head, and pursed her lips.

Dr. Cockroach walked up to them.
113232112211.title: Engaged

1132321122112.content:
"Ginormica and Dr. Cockroach!" shouted a familiar voice.

"Monger, your timing's worse than those Fabreeze things," said Dr. Cockroach a he turned to look down at the General.

"You have rotten timing," Susan said as she turned to look at the old man.

Monger had a grin on his face. "Sorry for catching you in the middle of something," he said. "However, the creature we've been looking for has been spotted by the park. If we hurry, we might be able to catch it."

"So, where are the others?" Dr. Cockroach asked as he climbed down off of Susan.

"Told Link and B.O.B. to locate the creature, and watch it," said Monger. "As for Butterflyasurus, I left him at your folks' place Susan- don't want to risk any extra damage you know."

"And my parents?" ask Susan.

"They told me that they were going out for a walk," said the General. "Your mother told me that your father hadn't been sleeping too well."

"As long as they don't run into any trouble, they should be fine," Dr. Cockroach said.

"That they should," said Monger. "Uh Susan, would you mind giving us a lift- I left my Jeep back at your place."

Susan chuckled. "Not a problem General."

Fifteen minutes later, they located the other two on the outskirts of the park.

"Where's the creature?" Monger asked in a loud whisper as he got off of Susan's hand.

Link pointed towards some bushes. "Behind there," he said. "So tell me, did they do it?"

"You owe me twenty when we get back to base," the General said.

"What was the bet over?" Dr. Cockroach asked.

"If the two of you were kissing or not," said B.O.B.

"We were about to when the General interrupted us," Susan said. "Andrew here asked me to marry him. I said yes."

"Congratulations," said Link. He then looked at Monger. "I guess you owe me twenty- rule was if they were going to."

"I don't recall that rule," said Monger. "As it is, I want a closer look at this creature. Susan, mind standing up? I'd like to know what we're up against."

Susan stood up and saw the creature. It was a....
1132321122112.title: Interrupted- Creature been spotted

11323211221121.content:
The creature was a werewolf, and it was in its wolf form. It looked up at Susan, and started to back away, and breathing heavily.

"Take it easy," Susan said. "We're not here to hurt you."

The others came through the foliage, causing the werewolf to...
11323211221121.title: Werewolf

113232112211211.content:
The werewolf ran.

"Go after them," Monger shouted. "I'd like to catch them before the night's over."

The team gave chase.

"This is a new experience!" Link shouted. "Been chased a few times, but I've never done the chasing."

"What happened?" Susan asked.

"B.O.B. stepped on a thistle," Dr. Cockroach shouted.

"It hurts!" B.O.B. screamed. "Get it off me!"

"B.O.B., you're supposed to be indestructible," Monger shouted. "Quit complaining."

After a while, they managed to corner the werewolf.

"Just take it easy," Susan said, as she picked the werewolf up. However, she noticed something about the creature, that seemed familiar. "Hey guys, I think I know
113232112211211.title: Runaway Werewolf

1132321122112111.content: "I think I know him." Susan stared at the werewolf. Then she realized who he was.
1132321122112111.title: him."

choices: I was abducted by that alien you fought a few months back.
11323211221121111.content:
"Daddy?"

The werewolf looked at Susan. "It's me, Susie." Carl sighed, and looked away from his daughter. "This wasn't the way I wanted you to find out about my secret. It was your mother who finally convinced me to tell you; she said that your friends might be able to help me out. However, I was nervous; monsters tend to be destroyed you know."

"That's an exaggeration," Monger said. "We'd of just locked you up, with no contact allowed to the outside world."

"Tell me you're planning to change that policy?" Susan asked.

"Working on it; it's not easy to change military regulations, especially classified ones. Claiming that you're part of a Special Unit is the main way around it."

"So, what happened dad?" Susan asked. "Why are you a werewolf?"

"I'd like to know that myself," said Monger. "It's been a while since one of your sort has been confirmed to exist."

"It's like this...
11323211221121111.title: Daddy- Carl Murphy

1132321122112112.content: "I think I know her." Susan stared at the werewolf. Then she realized who she was.
1132321122112112.title: her."

choices: Yeah- the locals need help with something big.
1132322.content: Is the trouble around Coco Beach?
1132322.title: Another place

11323221.content:
"There's some trouble brewing locally," Monger said. "Local friendlies need some help, so I asked if I could provide it- as I told them I had a special unit vacationing nearby who could offer assistance. They gave me their permission."

"Did you tell them about us?" Susan asked, as the others came to them.

The general chuckled. "They'll find out soon enough- though given the recent photo-op, they've probably got an idea that it will be you."

"So, what is the trouble?" Link asked.

"The trouble is...."
11323221.title: Yeah- the locals need help with something big.

113232211.content:
"The trouble is a bank robbery," Monger said.

"Can't the locals deal with that on there own," Link said with a groan. "I don't feel like getting shot at- it was bad enough the last time I was here."

"Normally I would leave this to the locals," the general said. "However, there's some construction going on between the Station and the bank- it will take the police thirty minutes, if not more, to use the alternative route. Currently, there is one unit there, a single patrolman who radioed it in- he's all alone there. The opposition is a very powerful, and well-armed gang, and they have ties to certain criminal groups, including a few Middle Eastern ones."

"You don't mean-" Susan began.

"The very ones," Monger finished. "Wish I could deal with that group myself- wouldn't have mind collecting the bounty on the big guy's head if it weren't for the fact that I'm Government employed."

"So, do you have an idea about what are we going to do?" Dr. Cockroach asked.

"Not only do I have an idea, but I have a plan," the general chuckled, as the transport jet landed near them. "We'll be there in ten minutes tops."

"Uuuh, but I didn't get buried in the sand," B.O.B. said with a groan.

"I'm sure we'll get another chance," Susan said, as they boarded.
113232211.title: A Bank Robbery

choices: Things don't work out quite as Planned
1132322111.content:
Bullets flew around Officer Rico as he hid on the other side of his car.

"Guys, where's that Special Forces unit you said was coming to help out?" he asked to the car's radio, in the local Spanish dialect. "I told you that I can't take these guys on by myself- all I've got on me is my pistol." A bullet zipped passed his ear, forcing him to duck down lower to the ground. "These guys are making Swiss Cheese out of my car- I'm sort of surprised that they haven't taken the radio out."

"Hold on kid," said a North American voice in the local dialect, a voice with authority. "We're coming to help you out. Be with you in T-minus thirty seconds."

"About time," Rico muttered as he noticed the jet flying overhead, coming for a landing. It vanished from view as it landed a few blocks away, hidden by the USA-style skyscrapers. "There'd better be at least a dozen soldiers in that thing."

A minute later, he saw a military-looking man sticking their head out from behind the corner of an office building. "Looks like you've got a dozen men trained on you," came the man's voice. "We'll get you and the hostages out of there in just a moment."

"How many men do you have with you?" Rico asked.

"With the exception of my pilot, and including myself, you've got five friendlies with you," the man said. "Had to leave the really big guy behind."

"Your men had better be very good at their jobs then," Rico shouted. "There's at least fifteen of them, along with over a dozen hostages, and throw in the fact that I'm almost out of ammo."

With that, the man took off running towards him, bullets hitting just behind him. "Ye Ha!" the man shouted as he skidded to a stop beside Rico. "That's the most lead I've seen fly by me since my days of storming beaches in the Pacific!"

"Don't even bother translating," Rico muttered. "Stupid American."

"It wasn't stupid," said the man. "That was Phase One of my plan- Initial Distraction. While we're busy jawing, and getting shot at, Phase Two is underway- Through the Sewers- three of my men are using them to get to the restroom of that bank. Once they get into position, they'll contact me, and that's when Phase Three comes into play- Big Distraction- you might say my final man, or should I say woman, has a tank- forces our friends in there to shoot at her. While that's underway, the others will come through the bathroom, and take those bastards by surprise."

"Are you sure your plan will work?" Rico asked.

The man laughed. "I wouldn't be here if I didn't think it could work- might not work out the way I'd like it, but that's why I also formulated a backup plan- just in case."
1132322111.title: At the Robbery

choices: Shrunken in a rat cage held by Dr. Cockroach
With their arms held up- like in those Western movies
11323221111.content:
"General," said a voice from the man's wristwatch. "We're in position. Tell Susan to start Phase Three."

The man pressed a button on it. "Very good, Dr. Cockroach," he said into it. "Stay there until I tell you otherwise."

"Hey Monger," said another voice. "B.O.B.'s starting to snack on some of the stuff down here."

"In that case Link, tell him that I won't bake him any cake if he ruins his apatite," the man said with a chuckle. "And that's especially true if he doesn't listen to you guys."

"Will do General- just make sure to stop someplace to get one though."

Rico took another look at the man, and gave him a quick salute. "My apologies for being rude to you, General Monger. Everyone knows that you and your strange men are heroes."

"You understood that?" General Monger asked.

Rico nodded.

"Good" Monger said. He then pressed another button on his watch and spoke in English. "Susan- begin Phase Three."

Rico stared in amazement as the 15 meter woman known as Ginormica came out from behind the office building. Immediately, the bank robbers began firing at her. The woman crossed her arms and stood there. When the guns quieted, she said, "Is that all you've got boys?" She then licked her lips, and began walking forward again. "Guess what boys- I'm hungry!"

"Alright you guys," Monger said into his watch. "Take them out!"

Rico then heard the sounds of screaming, and fighting, and yelling, and an evil sounding laugh.

"Those boys are having the time of their lives," Monger said with a chuckle. He then looked at Rico. "No translation needed right?"

Rico shook his head. "La traducción no es necesaria."

Monger grinned.

"Is there anything else you'd like me to do?" Susan asked as she walked over to them.

"I doubt there's anything we need to do now," Monger said. He then turned to Rico. "What's your name young man?"

"It's Rico, sir."

"Well Rico, when my men come out with those goons, I'd like you to go in and reassure those people, and tell them that everything is alright."

"I can do that," Rico said as the group of bank robbers came out...
11323221111.title: Plan works Perfectly

11323222.content: Is the trouble back at Area 50- whatever?
11323222.title: Back at the Base?

113232221.content:
"It's like this," said Monger. "Before we came here I received word about a monster causing some trouble. Now, I didn't want to interrupt your much needed vacation, so I sent the Capture Team after the creature."

"Anything happen to them?" Susan asked.

"Not really, though the creature was groggy for a while," Monger said. "After all, we try to capture them alive- keeps Public Relations on our side, along with those Animal Rights activists, for the most part."

"Sounds like Susan will be the first one to say 'Hi' to the NewMon," said Dr. Cockroach.

"What are you talking about?" Susan asked.

"He's right," said Monger. "You get to be the first one to talk to the NewMon."

"The what?"

"The New Monster," Link said. "As the old new monster, you are the first one to talk to the new guy- it helps them get settled in after they've been having guns pointed in their faces, and guys watching them as they write in notebooks, all day. Makes things easier when they have someone to relate with."

"Then why did Doctor Cockroach talk to me first?" Susan asked.

"The Invisible Man was the one who should have talked to you," said Dr. Cockroach. "Of course, he was unable to, as you know."

"Know what?" B.O.B. asked.

"Know that you get to bury Butterflysaurus in the sand now?" said Monger.

"Yeah!" B.O.B. shouted. "I get to bury him in the sand!" He then began to head towards the big butterfly creature.

"Link, keep him from causing too much trouble," said Monger.

"No problem," Link chuckled as he started to walk after B.O.B.. "I'm sure the big guy will enjoy being buried, well, as best as one can bury him."

"So, how's our new roomie doing?" Dr. Cockroach asked.

Monger said.....
113232221.title: Trouble's at the Base

1132322211.content:
"She's not settling down," said Monger.

"She?" Link asked as he came back. "Second monster captured within a year and it's also a female?"

"Is there are problem with that?" Susan asked.

"That might depend on the situation," Cockroach said with a nervous chuckle. "I mean, even normal human women have their issues."

"To say the least," Link said as he rolled his eyes. "Us guys already have a Status Quo thing. Throw a few women into the mix, there might be trouble."

"Especially if one of them doesn't like the rest of us," said Cockroach.

"Alright," said Monger. "Enough of the chit-chat. I have the jet coming to pick us up. Make sure that B.O.B. has his fun before we go- I don't want to hear him whining on the way to the base."

Some hours later, the group was back at the base, on a platform heading towards the observation pen.

"I still wish we were back at the beach," B.O.B. said. "I didn't get to finish burying Butterflysaurus."

"No, but you buried his feet," said Link. "That was a good achievement."

"We'll go back some time," Susan said. "Am I right?"

"I'll arrange it," said Monger. "For now, let's deal with our new roommate."

As they drew closer, Susan could hear pounding.

"Sounds like the old Escape Attempt routine," Monger said. "Won't work though- those walls can withstand a nucular blast."

"So were Gallaxhar's doors, but I went through them like butter," Susan said. "Why didn't that happen when I tried to escape from here?"

"You weren't that angry when you tried your escape attempt," Monger said with a chuckle. "I pray that you never get that angry here. If you had been, you could have brought the whole place down."

Susan chuckled nervously. "I hope I don't. The place has grown on me."

"It certainly has," Link said. "Now that we're free, don't need to escape."

"Alright," Monger said as the platform docked near the pen. "Let's see what we have here." He then walked up to a special TV screen and turned it on, to reveal the new creature. She was a....
1132322211.title: New Female Monster

choices: She broke the sound recorder on the inside."
We turned it off. She was giving us a headache."
11323222111.content:
Susan saw that she was looking at the face of a werewolf, and she was a pounding and a pounding near the camera.

"She been at this long?" Monger asked.

"The last couple of hours," said one the the scientists. "Hasn't stopped for anything, not even food. We gave her some fine beef too."

"Might not be used to the tube," said Cockroach.

"That is a possibility," said the scientist. "However, no one wants to go in there. Don't blame them really."

"Say, isn't there speakers to this thing?" Link asked as he walked up to the control panel.

"There is," the scientist said. "However....
11323222111.title: Werewolf

113232221122.content:
Let's have a few options for the new Monster-

1. Go down the traditional routes - anything and everything from fantasy, mythology, and even Sci-Fi and Horror.

2. Create your own creature. Make something really freaky - like a werewolf/kitsune hybrid thing that has the wings of a bat, and the fire-breathing ability of a dragon - or something else.

3. Make a crossover - there's plenty of films and such out there.

1132322211222.content:

A werewolf/kitsune hybrid thing that has the wings of a bat, and the fire-breathing ability of a dragon

1132322211223.content:
Here's some Crossover possibilities.

2. Ogress Princess Fiona from the Shrek series. Again, the last guy that asked the question is unable to respond.
1132322211223.title: Crossover

choices: Martian Mouse, as in from Biker Mice From Mars.
Hockey-playing-alien-duck, as in the Mighty Ducks TV series.
11323222112233.content:
Let's think back to some cartoons from the 90's.

Martian Mouse, as in from Biker Mice From Mars. Perhaps Carbine ended up in MVA, or perhaps something strange happened to the human mechanic, Charley, that turned her into a humanoid mouse like her friends.

Hockey-playing-alien-duck, as in the Mighty Ducks TV series. You've got Mallory, ex-Puckworld Special Forces, or you've got Tanya, genius inventor/scientist.

Charley - Mechanic - Mutated into a Martian Mouse
113232221122331.content:

She'll have white fur underneath her chin, and on the front side of her body - like Vinnie, brown on the rest of her head, and back, like Throttle, and dark grey fur on her arms and legs, like Modo.

choices: Yep, Swallow Falls. Probably has to deal with mutant food.
113232222.content: Is it at a small island underneath the A in Atlantic Ocean on a map of the World? Also known as Swallow Falls?
113232222.title: A small Island underneath the A in Atlantic?

choices: That might not actually be the case.
There's still a lot of food that needs to be picked up.
1132322221.content:
(For more about the movie, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloudy_with_a_Chance_of_Meatballs_(film).)

"The trouble's at a small island in the Mid-Atlantic called Swallow Falls," said the General. "Though they changed it a while back to ChewandSwallow after a certain incident."

"Wasn't that where the one guy caused it to rain food?" Susan asked.

"The very one," said Monger. "As you know, a man by the name of Flint Lockwood managed to convert water into food using a special machine. Problem was, too many people made special orders, especially the previous Mayor, who, from all accounts, turned himself into a gluttonous overweight pig, and had ordered a Las Vegas styled all-you-can-eat buffet before destroying the device that allowed people to communicate with the machine. Thankfully, Lockwood and some of his friends were able to stop the machine and apparently destroyed it."

"What does that have to do with us then?" Link asked. "I mean, the machine is gone right?"

"Yes but....
1132322221.title: It's Swallow Falls

choices: "It's a teleporter." he said beaming a cockroachy smile.
"It's a normaliser. It'll make us normal."
A mile out from the shore, a periscope was watching the developments.
The general whizzed in on his jetpac with an urgent mission.
"Hey keep it down." a monstrous voice calls from the shadows.
12.content:
Dr. Cockroach was enjoying the break. At least that's what Susan thought, as she listened to him cackle as he worked on the barbecue grill. None of the monsters believed he was cooking burgers or sausages.

The general had dropped them off, on the nuclear test atoll, in the middle of the Pacific, free from spying eyes, and realistic escape.

Link was sunbathing, and peeking past the edge of his sunglasses, still hopeful that if he looked just once more girls would magically appear. That he could impress with his surfing skills.

BOB was chatting up a jelly fish that had washed up on the beach.

Susan gave a contented sigh, as she took in the scene. Her head resting on her folded arms.

It was weird, but for her they were all as precious as family.

"Done it. I've Done It!"

Stepping back from the... well, it certainly wasn't a grill anymore. He performed a little dance, for a few moments. Until he noticed that he wasn't the centre of attention. Link lifted his sunglasses, and gave a disinterested glance in his direction. BOB was as ever oblivious.

Susan stepped up for her friend.

"Done what?" she asked,her voice chipper. There was always a sense of dread she prepared for, with his answers. Shielding her eyes, she tried to guess what it was that the baroque mess of pipes did. She missed butterflysaurus, even if just as a handy sunblock. But the general had confided in her, that he was just to big a flight risk.

"Ah Susan, Susan, Susan."
12.title: Dr. Cockroach PhD

choices: Gru outlines his plan for an alliance.
Back on the Atoll, Ginormica has spotted the periscope.
Bob is smitten by the sight of Ginormica.
123.content:
The captain of the submarine's arm was shaken vigorously, his view shooting violently left and right.

With a sigh, he lifted his gaze away from the periscope. Looking down, he saw Bob looking up at him, big smile splitting his face. In his hand he held out a cup of coffee, half of which was sloshing around the saucer.

"Bello. Koffee." he lifted it higher, afraid his boss might miss the reason for his interruption.

Gru was used to his minions less than perfect behaviour. But it was always well intentioned, so he smiled and took the coffee.

The coffee went flying, as Bob jumped onto Herb's shoulders. Together, they were tall enough for Bob to look through the periscope.

"Monstah... Monstah..." he babbled excitedly, until he fell to the floor. His glasses clanged against the metal decking of the sub.
123.title: A mile out from the shore, a periscope was watc...

155332222.title: Gallaxhar's Computer

info.brief_description: Looks like the Monsters have been sent on another Mission. 3,700+ Views
info.description:
After saving the Earth from an alien invasion, not to mention some nasty vegetables, the Monsters, Susan Murphy/Ginormica, the Missing Link, B.O.B., and Dr. Cockroach, (as well as Butterflysaurus) decide to take a break and have some fun on a beach someplace.

Susan is wearing an extra-extra-extra large sized bikini- courtesy of a certain top secret section of the military run by General W.R. Monger, and is catching up on her tan. Wouldn't mind getting herself a new boyfriend, but, in spite of her friendly disposition, her large size, and her strange friends, tend to put most men off.

Link is currently in the ocean, chasing after some co-eds who are water skiing, or was that a pretty mermaid he mentioned he'd be chasing? It was one of them.

B.O.B., well, he's being B.O.B., thinking that other peoples' thoughts are his own, and probably causing some trouble with the local chemical plants.

Dr. Cockroach is currently working on a few machines, one that can transform him between his cockroach form and a human one, and another that can cause Susan to change her size, so that she can be a normal-sized person when she wants to and a giantess when greater strength is needed.

Butterflysaurus is well, being an oversized butterfly, and is probably causing problems hovering around a nearby power plant, or a stadium with bright lights.

However, their vacation gets cut short when General W.R. Monger shows up with some big news- he has another mission for them. This mission could range from a rogue monster attacking a city, Gallaxhar showing up for revenge, a natural/unnatural disaster affecting some city, or some lame photo-shoot being held to make sure that Area 50-(whatever it's called) gets its funding from Congress, or anything else.

The Rules:
1. Try to keep the characters in character- as much as possible.

2. The level is to be 13+, so if the Monsters get into a fight with someone, little to no gore, and try to make deaths ambiguous- (meaning that there is a chance that the person actually survived), or not shown- such as when the giant robot attacked the US military or when the spaceship blew up- there had to be some deaths but they weren't shown, with the exception of a couple of alien clones.

3. Comedy and humor (plus some mild crude humor) is recommended- this is based off of a DreamWorks movie after all, and they are well known for being comedies.

4. The other monsters that the Monsters encounter might be friendly, but be either pranksters or accident-prone, or they might be evil, or someplace in-between.

5. Spelling and Grammar are a must.

6. Story is to be told in 3rd person point of view.

7. Have fun.

For the Wikipedia link see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monsters_vs._Aliens
http://monstersvsaliens.wikia.com/wiki/Monsters_Vs._Aliens_Wiki
